meanings.sent1: She felt awfully tired after running the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The storm was awfully loud last night.
meanings.sent3: He was awfully surprised when he saw the birthday cake.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident hit her awfully hard.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream was awfully delicious on a hot day.

meanings.definition: In a manner inspiring awe or fear
meanings.sent1: The magician performed awfully well at the show.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was awfully spooky at night.
meanings.sent3: The giant statue looked awfully majestic in the park.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest seemed awfully mysterious under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm was awfully powerful, shaking the windows.

meanings.definition: Used to express disapproval or criticism
meanings.sent1: Awfully! That was not a nice thing to say.
meanings.sent2: Awfully, I must disagree with your decision.
meanings.sent3: Awfully, that movie was a waste of time.
meanings.sent4: Awfully, I can't believe you forgot my birthday.
meanings.sent5: Awfully, this weather is ruining our plans.
